item.text:
Tax Refund Responsibility Act

This bill requires the governor of Guam to ensure that (1) each refund claim relating to the Guam income tax is processed within 90 days after it is filed, (2) valid refunds are issued within 90 days after the refund form is filed, and (3) a sufficient percentage of taxes collected by the government of  Guam is deposited into the Guam Income Tax Refund Efficient Payment Trust Fund to cover the cost of refunds.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Tax Refund Responsibility Act
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 144 (Tuesday, September 10, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SAN NICOLAS:H.R. 4262.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 of the Constitution,Congress's authority to make all rules and regulationsrespecting the Territories and possessions[Page H7597]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.fullName: Rep. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.title: Tax Refund Responsibility Act
item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

item.title: To ensure that refunds of overpayments of the Guam Territorial Income Tax are issued in a timely manner, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
